content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-260-11-A |Item_parent=Hematuria |Item_parent_short=Hematuria |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the diagnostic tree for haematuria |Description=Figure |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Charles Dariane, Bruno Moulin |Order=11}} [[File:Figure 6 diagnostic tree.png|thumbnail|1050x1050px| '''Figure 6. Diagnostic tree for haematuria'''|alt=|neant]]

properties.question: In the diagnostic tree for haematuria, which of the following is NOT a typical initial step in the evaluation process?
properties.option_a: Urinalysis to confirm the presence of blood in the urine
properties.option_b: Imaging studies such as ultrasound or CT scan
properties.option_c: Blood tests to assess kidney function and screen for other conditions
